subtitle: Recording defence sites in Northern Ireland
author: Lorraine Barry, GIS Unit, Queens University Belfast
featuresBlurb:
Record, preserve and monitor local defence history.
Project collaboration by the DoE, Living Legacies and managed visually and spatially by the GIS Research and Teaching Unit, Queen's University Belfast.The Defence Heritage Project continues to be developed through public contribution of site stories.
aboutParagraph: Northern Irelandâ€™s defence heritage represents a significant cultural legacy. There are many 20th-century defensive structures dotted around the countryside and coast of Northern Ireland. Examples include training trenches, gun and searchlight emplacements, pillboxes, observation posts, airfields, naval and flying boat bases, among others. This application publicises existing sites and provides a platform for contribution of new site information.
organizationName: GIS Research and Teaching Unit, Queen's University Belfast
contactUs: For application content contact the GIS Unit, Queen's University Belfast, l.barry@qub.ac.uk
videoIntroduction: The Defence Heritage Project Features on Episode 2 of BBC NI's Home Ground Series, aired on 2nd May 2016.
featuresSectionName: Record information on sites in Northern Ireland with a defence history
